intro: Goniolimon tataricum f. ciliatum, commonly known as the ciliated tatarian goniolimon, is a rare and delicate plant belonging to the Plumbagaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It is native to Central Asia and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
